posts.name: Enishan Eren Gücük
posts.cooked: Hello, this year we are using mk4i L2 and neo engines, but when we rotate the robot around itself and move it forward, the robot slips. What could be the reason for this? Our robot does not have a problem with orientation. I can send a video if you want @nstrike
Please send a video and link to your code

posts.name: Enishan Eren Gücük
posts.cooked:
main

Anka. Contribute to Enishangck/Anka development by creating an account on GitHub.

This will always drift a little bit and dont bother tuning this until uou have your full robot built. To tune this you first tune the chassis discretization, and then the angular velocity coefficient. Both are functions in the SwerveDrive .

Really its not worth it most of the time just use a vision processor. It does get you over that little bump

posts.name: Enishan Eren Gücük
posts.cooked: The problem is not that it slides, the problem is that when I push the joystick forward, it slides to the right. First time we using pigeon 2 and we dont have this problem after we changed pigeon 2 to navX this happened

I know, again don’t bother trying to fix this yet bc the second you add or remove weight it will need to be tuned again.

Guides to tune this are here

More math...

Reasoning is here

Whitepaper: Swerve Drive Skew and Second Order Kinematics CD-Media: Papers

And we no longer implement second order kinematics bc the difference was not significant enough

link_counts.title: Whitepaper: Swerve Drive Skew and Second Order Kinematics

posts.cooked:
I posted some more info here

Share your tricks you used to improve your autos Programming

link_counts.title: Share your tricks you used to improve your autos

posts.cooked: Pugeon2’s have a higher sampling rate than the NavX so they are more accurate while doing this, you can compensate in code but it is a pain. This is why the pigeon 2 costs more than a navx. A CANandGyro should be able to do as well if not better than the Pigeon2
